mods.abstract: A RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the jail of the Parish of St. Landry on the 25th June last, a negroman calling himself ONEZIME, aged about 35 years, five feet, four inches high, having large whiskers, he speaks french and english. Onézime says he belongs to a Mr. Lézin Landry or Guidry, living in the Parish of Lafayette, where he ran away about four months ago. He had in his possession a dark bay horse, with long black mane and tail, lately altered, said horse is old, and branded on the left thigh and shoulder, which he says belongs to Mr. Paul Lalonde. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, July 1st, 1854.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
